taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Adults inhabit sluggish pools and backwaters of large rivers, swamps, bayous, and lakes.  Rarely enter brackish and marine waters (Ref. 5723).  Feed on blue crabs, turtles, waterfowl or other birds and small mammals (Ref. 10294).  Giant of the gars (Ref. 5723).  Marketed fresh (Ref. 37032).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  ranges from Mississippi River basin from southwestern Ohio and southern Illinois in USA south to Gulf of Mexico; Gulf of Mexico Coastal Plain from Enconfina River in Florida, USA to Veracruz, Mexico.
dataObjects.references: Page, L.M. and B.M. Burr 1991 A field guide to freshwater fishes of North America north of Mexico. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 432 p. (Ref. 5723)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.description: Maximum size: 3050 mm  OT

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 305 cm OT (male/unsexed; (Ref. 3221)); max. published weight: 137.0 kg (Ref. 58490)
references: McClanes, A.J. (ed.) 1974 Field guide to freshwater fishes of North America. Holt, Rinehart and Winston, New York. 212 p. (Ref. 3221)
Stone, R. 2007 The last of the leviathans. Science 316:1684-1688. (Ref. 58490)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Large size and broad, short snout.  Light dorsal stripe.  Dark olivaceous brown above and white to yellowish beneath.  Dark brown blotches on all fins (Ref. 37032).
